name: Finding concentration of the sample
description:
In this kata, we are chemistry technician, trying to measure the concentration of a coloured compound in a sample solution. 

Concentration is proportional to the absorbance of the solution. 
We were given 2 standard points in the form of e.g. [2,2], [4,4]. Indicating 2 units concentration of this chemical will absorb 2 units of light and 4 units concentration of this chemical will absorb 4 units of light.

Absorbance of the sample will be measured in the form of e.g. 3, indicating 3 units of light is absorbed.

you will be required to make a code to calculate the concentration of the certain compound. (note that the answer will not be negative)
In the example, by forming a linear line of [2,2] and [4,4] and substitue 3 as the absorbance, the concentration will be 3.

In case you were not familiar with chemistry setting, you can just assume it is a quest to find the x coordinate of a point with given y coordinate on a straight line.

Caution!!
There will be some cases where the answer cannot be determined, lets say if the 2 points are the same points, the line is a horizontal(where the y coordinate of both points are the same)  vertical line (x coordinate of both points are the same). In this case, having experimental error, we will output -1 as a sign of error as concentration will not be negative.

Becareful not to mix up x-axis and y-axis. Happy coding!

Example:
input[2,2],[4,4],3 output should be 3
input[1,6],[3,9],12 output should be 5
input[1,0],[3,0],0 as there is experimental error, output should be -1
